title: Opinion | A new leap in opportunities for the exploration and utilization of space
summary: Although the development of the SLS was driven by launch needs for human exploration of the Moon and Mars, it provides a much greater level of capability for the broader spacefaring community.

title: Investing in Space: The space station kingmaker
summary: Several U.S. companies are working to build new orbiting habitats to replace the aging International Space Station. NASA’s role in seeding the fledgling market was a hot topic at the FAA’s space conference last week.

title: Chinese rocket firm Space Pioneer set for first launch
summary: HELSINKI — Commercial launch firm Space Pioneer announced new funding this week and will soon take a shot at becoming China’s first such company to reach orbit with a liquid propellant rocket. Space Pioneer, full name Beijing Tianbing Technology Co., Ltd., announced Feb. 15 that it recently secured “B+ and “Pre-C” strategic funding rounds. The […]

title: Virgin Galactic aircraft returns to flight
summary: The carrier aircraft for Virgin Galactic’s suborbital spaceplane made its first flight in more than a year Feb. 15 as the company moves one step closer to beginning commercial service.

title: Boeing opens SLS EUS production facility
summary: Boeing has opened the production facility where it will build a new upper stage for an upgraded version of the Space Launch System.
